description: The underlying cause of CVE-2023-6347 is a use-after-free vulnerability in the mojo interface of the Chromium open source software, which is utilized by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). This flaw occurs when memory is accessed after it has already been freed, leading to potential memory corruption and exploitation. The specific versions affected include Microsoft Edge version 119.0.2151.97 and earlier releases based on Chromium, as well as the related extended stable build 118.0.2088.122. This vulnerability was addressed in the stable release published on November 29, 2023, with corresponding updates provided through KB-119.0.2151.97. The resolution ensures that the latest builds of Edge no longer expose users to this risk, improving overall application security.
